title: Chichewa (1966) Genesis Portion
description: Chichewa translation of the first four chapters of Genesis published in 1966 by The Bible Society in Malawi. Chewa is a Bantu language spoken in much of Southern, Southeast and East Africa, namely the countries of Malawi and Zambia, where it is an official language, and Mozambique and Zimbabwe where it is a recognised minority language.

language.name: Nyanja
language.area: West central and southwest. Also in Botswana, Mozambique, Swaziland, Zambia, Zimbabwe.
